metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1930 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 44.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Nils Ohlmeier, Gary Kwong, Jesse Ruderman, Carsten Book, and Randell Jesup

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
